metadata.title: Input Variables - HCL Configuration Language
metadata.description:
Input variables are parameters for Packer modules.
This page covers configuration syntax for variables.

outlineItems.title: A variable value must be known:

HCL2 templates
were first introduced as a beta feature into Packer version 1.5. As of v1.7,
HCL2 support is no longer in beta, and is the preferred way to write Packer
configuration. For the old-style stable configuration language see
`,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/packer/docs/templates/legacy_json_templates"},`template docs`),`. As of v1.6.2, you can

`,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/packer/docs/commands/hcl2_upgrade"},`hcl2_upgrade command`),`.`)),mdx("p",null,`There are two kinds of variables in HCL Packer templates: Input variables,
sometimes simply called "variables", and Local variables, also known as
"locals". Input variables may have defaults, but those defaults can be
overridden using command line options, environment variables, or variable
definitions files. However, nothing can change the value of an input variable
after the initial override.`),mdx("p",null,`This page is about input variables. To learn about local variables, see the

metadata.title: Packer by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Packer helps you create golden images for multiple platforms from a single source configuration.

integrationsConfig.description: A curated collection of official, partner, and community Packer Integrations.
